definitions: To throw the football to the ground immediately after a play to stop the game clock, often to save time or avoid a penalty.
To celebrate a success or achievement in an ostentatious or showy way, often by mimicking the action of spiking a football.
examples: The quarterback had to spike the ball to stop the clock.
After scoring the winning goal, she ran to the crowd to spike the ball.
They decided to spike the ball after closing the big deal.
He fumbled the snap and had to spike the ball to avoid a delay of game penalty.
